title: SNP-controlled Glasgow is pothole capital of Britain with Labour-led Edinburgh second
description: Across Britain, the Scottish capital Glasgow - run by an SNP -led minority council - had more than 9,700 potholes reported by residents over the past 17 years, less than a third of which have been repaired. Edinburgh has had less than a quarter of the 5,538 reported potholes being filled in since 2007, the data shows.

title: Thousands gather in Edinburgh to call for immediate ceasefire in Gaza
description: Thousands of pro-Palestine supporters gathered in Edinburgh on Saturday in support of an immediate ceasefire in Gaza. Carrying Palestinian flags and placards, they marched from Edinburgh Castle down the Royal Mile to the Scottish Parliament, shouting slogans such as: “No Justice, No Peace”, and: “Ceasefire now!”

title: Delivering new affordable homes is SNP priority, says MSP
description: Delivering new homes has ensured that the annual supply of affordable housing has been the highest in Britain per 10,000 population each year since the SNP took office in 2007. In 2023 alone - at a time of huge financial challenge - 10,582 affordable homes were completed in Scotland, 1,592 of which were high quality council houses.

title: Moray MSP Richard Lochhead looks ahead in 2024 following another busy year representing the region
description: AFTER 18 years as Moray’s SNP MSP, Richard Lochhead is looking forward to supporting the area’s communities again in 2024. title: CalMac ferry fares could rise up to 40 per cent for island visitors under Scottish Government review
description: Their so-called “ road equivalent tariff ” (RET) has cut the average fares for cars by an estimated 40 per cent and for passengers by 34 per cent across CalMac’s west coast network since being extended to all its routes in 2015. Coaches are included in the scheme but not lorries or other vehicles more than 6m long.
